design_background: Bulls dynasty peak period; bold red home identity became synonymous with 90s championship basketball.
cultural_notes: Associated with The Last Shot and global NBA expansion era.

design_background: Post-Shaq championship era visual symbol; clean gold body with purple trim represented legacy continuity.
cultural_notes: Back-to-back title period cemented No.24 iconography.

design_background: Black away palette marked a tougher identity shift and matched early-2000s aggressive styling.
cultural_notes: Strong connection to street culture entering mainstream basketball aesthetics.

design_background: Showtime era uniform used strong contrast and minimal striping to emphasize pace and visibility.
cultural_notes: One of the most recognizable 80s sports visual identities.

design_background: Classic Celtic block typography and restrained trim reflected franchise traditionalism.
cultural_notes: A visual counterpoint to Lakers Showtime aesthetics.

design_background: Low-saturation silver-black system mirrored Spurs' fundamentals-first identity.
cultural_notes: Often cited as minimalism done right in team sports kits.

design_background: Updated Rockets cut and cleaner side panels aligned with 2000s template modernization.
cultural_notes: Cross-market significance in NBA globalization across Asia.

design_background: High-contrast black alternate echoed Miami's modern, performance-forward visual language.
cultural_notes: Core jersey of Heat title-era highlight culture.

design_background: Balanced geometric striping and clean numerals fit late-2000s NBA template standards.
cultural_notes: Linked with one of the most celebrated underdog title runs.

design_background: Refined bridge-era visual system with sharp type and modern trim rhythm.
cultural_notes: Associated with pace-and-space and long-range shooting revolution.
